Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
blues \blues\ n. a type of folk song that originated among Black Americans at the beginning of the 20th century; has a melancholoy sound from repeated used of blue notes. [WordNet 1.5]
2. a state of depression; as, he had a bad case of the blues.
Syn: megrims. [WordNet 1.5]

blues n 1: a type of folksong that originated among Black Americans at the beginning of the 20th century; has a melancholy sound from repeated use of blue notes 2: a state of depression; "he had a bad case of the blues" [syn: {blue devils}, {megrims}, {vapors}, {vapours}]
